data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There is a compass in your head and you are going around. Once you are around, you turn around to turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn around, we need to walk back toward the starting point. In taking six steps, we take 6 steps. Taking 4 steps puts us at 6 steps. In taking 10 steps, we take 10 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

Turn left then take one step. Turn left then take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

The starting point doesn't require any steps to be back to the starting point. Take 4 steps and take 3 more steps and take the same distance as before. So, the answer is no.

If you always face forward, you can return to the starting point when you complete one exercise. So, the answer is Yes.

You don’ t have to turn around and take 2 steps to return to the starting point. You can take 3 steps or a total of 9 steps. You can also take 3 steps in one sequence or 3 steps in 4 sequences. So, the answer is No.

The original position of the starter is facing forward. The previous position is facing in the opposite direction. There are no step backs where you start from. The starting point is on the left side, facing across. So, the answer is No.

You aren' t going to take 4 steps left unless you were to go into a circle and walk the entire way through. The starting point i s always facing forward by facing away from anything, so it is unlikely that the instructions suggest you take 4 steps left. Thus, the answer is no.
